CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 26, 1961, pg. 17 reads: "Open To Serve - A health and welfare center recently was opened by Ethnan Temple Seventh Day Adventist Church, 662 Bryn Mawr Rd., Pittsburgh. Left to right: Mmes. Louise Davis, Ellen Allesberry, Win Thomas, G. Woods, E. Washington, Marjorie Randolph and Alberta Peterson.  in door: Councilman James A. Jordon, Mrs. Eunice Cook, who served as mistress of ceremonies, and Elder Nelson Bloss, pastor.  Right side of door: Mrs. Bessie Mathison, leader of the center; Charles Thompkins, first aid director; Mmes. Mae Berry, Belle Bates and Madge Harris.  Back row: Mmes. Sallie Williams, Pauline Jackson, Elizabeth Campbell and Dorothea Taylor. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group of men and women, most wearing service uniforms, including Eunice Cook seated in center between Elder Nelson Bloss and James A. Jordon, gathered outside of Seventh Day Adventist Health Welfare Center building with car and belgian block street in foreground
